data.title: Azul Endgame Scoring
data.statement:
Azul is a tile-drafting board game. The game ends when one or more players end a round with a completed row of tiles on their wall.

The wall is a 5x5 array of tile slots to which players add tiles round by round.

Your goal is to print the score earned for the wall in the endgame phase. Points are awarded for completed rows, columns and colours (5 tiles of the same colour).

A fully completed board looks as below (tile colours are {{B Y R K W}}):
{{B Y R K W
W B Y R K
K W B Y R
R K W B Y
Y R K W B}}

You score <<2 points>> for every completed row, <<7 points>> for every completed column and <<10 points>> for every completed colour (5 of the same colour).

The fully-complete board above would then earn <<2>>*5 + <<7>>*5 + <<10>>*5 = 95 points (the maximum score).

Unfilled tiles are marked as "{{.}}" in the input. Any row/column with a "{{.}}" is incomplete. A colour is only complete if it appears 5 times on the board.

Print the score for the wall represented by the 5 [[row]]s provided in the input,

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Azul is a tile-drafting board game. The game ends when one or more players end a round with a completed row of tiles on their wall.

The wall is a 5x5 array of tile slots to which players add tiles round by round.

Your goal is to print the score earned for the wall in the endgame phase. Points are awarded for completed rows, columns and colours (5 tiles of the same colour).

A fully completed board looks as below (tile colours are B Y R K W):
B Y R K W
W B Y R K
K W B Y R
R K W B Y
Y R K W B

You score 2 points for every completed row, 7 points for every completed column and 10 points for every completed colour (5 of the same colour).

The fully-complete board above would then earn 2*5 + 7*5 + 10*5 = 95 points (the maximum score).

Unfilled tiles are marked as "." in the input. Any row/column with a "." is incomplete. A colour is only complete if it appears 5 times on the board.

Print the score for the wall represented by the 5 rows provided in the input,
Input
5 lines : 5 space-separated characters representing a row of placed tiles, unplaced tiles represented by ".", coloured tiles represented by B, Y, R, K, W.
Output
1 line : The integer score earned for this wall, following Azul's endgame scoring rules.
Constraints
Input will always be a valid 5x5 board.
Example
Input
B Y R K W
. . Y . K
K . . Y .
R . . . .
. . . . .
Output
2
